abstract.text: Associates the provided samples with the specified workout.

inlineContent.text: Use HKWorkoutBuilder

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An array containing
or
objects.
The workout object you are adding samples to.
A block that this method calls as soon as the add-samples operation is complete. This block is passed the following parameters:
A Boolean value. This parameter contains
if the samples were successfully added to workout; otherwise,
success
An error object. If an error occurred, this object contains information about the error; otherwise, it is set to
error

This method operates asynchronously. As soon as the add-samples operation is finished, this method calls the completion block on a background queue. You must save the workout to the HealthKit store before you can add any samples to it. You can save the samples before calling this method, but doing so is not required. This method automatically saves any unsaved samples when it successfully adds them to the workout.
To query for all the samples associated with a workout, add the workout to the query’s predicate. For example, the query’s
method creates a predicate object that matches only samples associated with the provided workout.
For more information on workouts and associated samples, see

abstract.text: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A sample with values from a short list of possible values.
The access point for all data managed by HealthKit.
Associates the provided samples with the specified workout.
Ends a workout session for the current app.
Starts a workout session for the current app.
A sample that represents a quantity, including the value and the units.
Returns a predicate that matches any objects that have been associated with the provided workout.
A HealthKit sample represents a piece of data associated with a start and end time.
A workout sample that stores information about a single physical activity.
Create associated samples that add details to a workout.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
